title: Apple unveils new iPhone 11 models, $4.99 price for streaming services: Live blog recap
text:
Apple Inc. highlighted the powerful cameras on its new lineup of iPhones on Tuesday, while revealing pricing and launch information for its streaming video and gaming services.

As expected, the company launched three new iPhones—the iPhone 11, 11 Pro, and 11 Pro Max—though there were some surprises in how Apple AAPL, +1.18% is pricing the devices and shaping its overall lineup. The iPhone 11 will start at $699, which is lowered than what its predecessor, the iPhone XR, cost prior to the announcement. Apple plans to keep the XR around for another year, lowering the price of that device to $599 in a bid to make its offerings a bit more affordable. The iPhone 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max, which both feature triple-lens cameras, begin at $999 and $1099, respectively.

Apple is planning a Sept. 19 launch for its Arcade gaming service, which will cost $4.99 a month for family access. Apple TV+, the company’s streaming video service, will have the same price tag when it rolls out on Nov. 1. Those who buy a new iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple TV, or iPod Touch get a year of the TV+ service for free.

The low price tag of Apple TV+ put pressure on shares of Roku Inc. ROKU, -10.49%, which are off more than 12% in Tuesday trading, as well as shares of Walt Disney Co. DIS, -2.19% and Netflix Inc. NFLX, -2.16%, which are also trading lower.
